query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Così discesi del cerchio primaio 2 giù nel secondo, che men loco cinghia 3 e tanto più dolor, che punge a guaio.
query.error: **English:** 1 Thus I descended from the first circle 2 down into the second, which girds a smaller space 3 and so much more pain, that it stings to lament.
query.result: 1 Þus ic of ðam æreste rince astah 2 niðer on ðone oðerne, ðe læsse rum bigeat, 3 and swa micle ða mare sár, ðæt hit to wopum gewent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Stavvi Minòs orribilmente, e ringhia: 5 essamina le colpe ne l’intrata; 6 giudica e manda secondo ch’avvinghia.
query.error: **English:** 4 There Minos stands horribly, and snarls: 5 he examines the sins at the entrance; 6 he judges and sends [the sinners] according to how he entwines himself.
query.result: 4 Þær stant Minos yslic and gryrelic, 5 and deð ðara synna on ðam inngange, 6 and dæmð and sent ðurh his wylce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Dico che quando l’anima mal nata 8 li vien dinanzi, tutta si confessa; 9 e quel conoscitor de le peccata
query.error: **English:** 7 I say that when the ill-born soul 8 comes before him, it confesses everything; 9 and that knower of sins

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 vede qual loco d’inferno è da essa; 11 cignesi con la coda tante volte 12 quantunque gradi vuol che giù sia messa.
query.error: **English:** 10 sees what place in hell is for it; 11 he lashes his tail as many times 12 as the number of levels he wants it to be cast down.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Sempre dinanzi a lui ne stanno molte: 14 vanno a vicenda ciascuna al giudizio, 15 dicono e odono e poi son giù volte.
query.error: **English:** 13 Many always stand before him: 14 they go in turn, each to judgment, 15 they speak and listen, and then they are turned down.
query.result: 13 Æfre him beforan stondað manega: 14 cumað bi dæge ælc to dome, 15 secgað and hlystað and beoð ðonne aweg gewende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 «O tu che vieni al doloroso ospizio», 17 disse Minòs a me quando mi vide, 18 lasciando l’atto di cotanto offizio,
query.error: **English:** 16 "O you who come to the sorrowful hostelry," 17 Minos said to me when he saw me, 18 leaving the act of his great office,
query.result: 16 "Eala ðu ðe cymeð to ðam sarigean inngeþeahte," 17 cwæð Minos to me ða he me geseah, 18 forlætende ðone weorc ðæs micclan weorces,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 «guarda com’ entri e di cui tu ti fide; 20 non t’inganni l’ampiezza de l’intrare!». 21 E ’l duca mio a lui: «Perché pur gride?
query.error: **English:** 19 "be careful how you enter and in whom you trust; 20 do not let the wideness of the entrance deceive you!" 21 And my guide to him: "Why do you cry out?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Non impedir lo suo fatale andare: 23 vuolsi così colà dove si puote 24 ciò che si vuole, e più non dimandare».
query.error: **English:** 22 Do not hinder his fated journey: 23 it is willed thus where it is possible 24 to do what one wants, and ask no more."
query.result: 22 Ne let þū his færlīcan gang: 23 hit is gewilnod þær hit mæg 24 þæt man wille, and ne āhsoh mā."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Or incomincian le dolenti note 26 a farmisi sentire; or son venuto 27 là dove molto pianto mi percuote.
query.error: **English:** 25 Now the sorrowful notes begin 26 to make themselves heard; now I have come 27 to where much lamentation strikes me.
query.result: 25 Nu ða wæfuligan leoð ongynnað 26 me to gehyrenne; nu ic cumen am 27 ðær micel heofung me onwæced.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Io venni in loco d’ogne luce muto, 29 che mugghia come fa mar per tempesta, 30 se da contrari venti è combattuto.
query.error: **English:** 28 I came to a place devoid of all light, 29 which roars like the sea in a storm, 30 when it is battered by opposing winds.
query.result: 28 Ic cwom ðær nanes leohtes wæs, 29 ðær ðæt sweg wæs swilce sæ on stormum, 30 ðonne hi wintræs geweald wederu wyrcað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 La bufera infernal, che mai non resta, 32 mena li spirti con la sua rapina; 33 voltando e percotendo li molesta.
query.error: **English:** 31 The infernal storm, which never rests, 32 drives the spirits with its violence; 33 turning and striking, it torments them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Quando giungon davanti a la ruina, 35 quivi le strida, il compianto, il lamento; 36 bestemmian quivi la virtù divina.
query.error: **English:** 34 When they arrive before the ruin, 35 there are outcries, weeping, and lamentations; 36 there they blaspheme the divine power.
query.result: 34 Þonne hi cumað to ðære hryre, 35 þær is hrymgealdor, hearm ond heofung, 36 þær hi witiað ðone wuldres God.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Intesi ch’a così fatto tormento 38 enno dannati i peccator carnali, 39 che la ragion sommettono al talento.
query.error: **English:** 37 I understood that to such torment 38 the carnal sinners are condemned, 39 who subject reason to desire.
query.result: 37 Ic ongeat ðæt to swylcum tintregum 38 syndon ða synfullan synfullan genydde, 39 ða ðe ða gesceadwisnesse ðam lustum underðeoddad.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 E come li stornei ne portan l’ali 41 nel freddo tempo, a schiera larga e piena, 42 così quel fiato li spiriti mali
query.error: **English:** 40 And as the starlings bear their wings 41 in the cold season, in a large and full flock, 42 so that wind carries the evil spirits
query.result: 40 And swa ða stearnan heora ða wengan berað 41 on ðam cealdan timan, on micelre menigo and fulre, 42 swa ðæt wind ða yflan gastas

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 di qua, di là, di giù, di sù li mena; 44 nulla speranza li conforta mai, 45 non che di posa, ma di minor pena.
query.error: **English:** 43 here, there, down, up it drives them; 44 no hope ever comforts them, 45 not to mention rest, but even of lesser pain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 E come i gru van cantando lor lai, 47 faccendo in aere di sé lunga riga, 48 così vid’ io venir, traendo guai,
query.error: **English:** 46 And as the cranes go chanting their lays, 47 making a long line of themselves in the air, 48 so I saw coming, uttering laments,
query.result: 46 And swa ða cranas farað singende heora leoð, 47 wyrkende on lyfte langne hereflota, 48 swa ic geseah cuman, heora wop hringende,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 ombre portate da la detta briga; 50 per ch’i’ dissi: «Maestro, chi son quelle 51 genti che l’aura nera sì gastiga?».
query.error: **English:** 49 shades borne by the aforesaid torment; 50 wherefore I said: "Master, who are those 51 people that the black air so castigates?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 «La prima di color di cui novelle 53 tu vuo’ saper», mi disse quelli allotta, 54 «fu imperadrice di molte favelle.
query.error: **English:** 52 "The first of those whose story 53 you want to know," he said to me then, 54 "was empress of many tongues.
query.result: 52 "Þæs frumsceaft fira feorran reccan, 53 ðe ðu wilt frinan, freond min Beowulf, 54 wæs Orosius se awisca."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 A vizio di lussuria fu sì rotta, 56 che libito fé licito in sua legge, 57 per tòrre il biasmo in che era condotta.
query.error: **English:** 55 She was so given over to the vision of lust, 56 that she made desire licit in her law, 57 in order to remove the blame into which she had been led.
query.result: 55 On gesihðe unrihtes heo wæs swa gewemmed, 56 ðæt heo ðone unriht on ðære æ ðeahte, 57 ðæt heo ðone teonan ðe heo on wæs awende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Ell’ è Semiramìs, di cui si legge 59 che succedette a Nino e fu sua sposa: 60 tenne la terra che ’l Soldan corregge.
query.error: **English:** 58 She is Semiramis, of whom one reads 59 that she succeeded Ninus and was his wife: 60 she held the land that the Sultan rules.
query.result: 58 Heo is Semiramus, ðe man ræt, 59 ðæt heo Ninuseftergenge wæs 60 and wæs his wif: heo ða land geheold

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 L’altra è colei che s’ancise amorosa, 62 e ruppe fede al cener di Sicheo; 63 poi è Cleopatràs lussurïosa.
query.error: **English:** 61 The other is she who killed herself for love, 62 and broke faith with the ashes of Sychaeus; 63 then there is lustful Cleopatra.
query.result: 61 Seo oðer is seo ðe hire self ofslog for lufe, 62 and bræc ðone geleafan æt ðæs Sicheus asce, 63 ða is seo galne Cleopatra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Elena vedi, per cui tanto reo 65 tempo si volse, e vedi ’l grande Achille, 66 che con amore al fine combatteo.
query.error: **English:** 64 See Helen, for whom so much evil 65 time passed, and see the great Achilles, 66 who fought with love to the end.
query.result: 64 Elena ðu gesyhst, for ðære ða earmlic 65 tid gewearð, and ðu gesyhst ðone mæran Ahile, 66 se ðe for lufan æt nextan feoht.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Vedi Parìs, Tristano»; e più di mille 68 ombre mostrommi e nominommi a dito, 69 ch’amor di nostra vita dipartille.
query.error: **English:** 67 See Paris, Tristan"; and more than a thousand 68 shades he showed me and named them with his finger, 69 whom love had separated from our life.
query.result: 67 Gesihð ðu Paris, Tristan"; and ma ðonne ðusend 68 sceawa he me sceawde and nemde mid fingre, 69 ðe ðurh ðæs lifes lufan forwurdon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Poscia ch’io ebbi ’l mio dottore udito 71 nomar le donne antiche e ’ cavalieri, 72 pietà mi giunse, e fui quasi smarrito.
query.error: **English:** 70 After I had heard my teacher 71 name the ancient ladies and knights, 72 pity seized me, and I was almost bewildered.
query.result: 70 Siððan ic hæfde minne lareow gehyred 71 nemnan ða wif geond ða world wide, 72 ða wearð me hreow on mode, and ic wæs nean forloren.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 I’ cominciai: «Poeta, volontieri 74 parlerei a quei due che ’nsieme vanno, 75 e paion sì al vento esser leggeri».
query.error: **English:** 73 I began: "Poet, I would gladly 74 speak to those two who go together, 75 and seem to be so light upon the wind."
query.result: 73 Ic ongan ða: "Lareow, lustlice 74 ic wolde ða twegen sprecan, ðe ðær samod wundað, 75 and ða swiðe ðinceð ðæt hie wind tosceofeð."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Ed elli a me: «Vedrai quando saranno 77 più presso a noi; e tu allor li priega 78 per quello amor che i mena, ed ei verranno».
query.error: **English:** 76 And he to me: "You will see when they are 77 nearer to us; and then you beg them 78 by that love which leads them, and they will come."
query.result: 76 And he to me: "Þu scealt geseon hwænne hi beoð 77 neor neah us; and þu ðonne bidde hi 78 ðurh ða lufe ðe hi lædeð, and hi cumað."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Sì tosto come il vento a noi li piega, 80 mossi la voce: «O anime affannate, 81 venite a noi parlar, s’altri nol niega!».
query.error: **English:** 79 As soon as the wind bends their feet toward us, 80 I moved my voice: "O weary souls, 81 come to speak with us, if no one else forbids it!"
query.result: 79 Swa swa ðe wind hyra fet lædeð, 80 ic ða wordum minum hreopum spræc: 81 "Eala ge wædle wæron, cumeð to us sprecan, gif eow nænig forwyrned!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Quali colombe dal disio chiamate 83 con l’ali alzate e ferme al dolce nido 84 vegnon per l’aere, dal voler portate;
query.error: **English:** 82 Like doves called by desire 83 with wings lifted and steady toward the sweet nest 84 come through the air, carried by their will;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 cotali uscir de la schiera ov’ è Dido, 86 a noi venendo per l’aere maligno, 87 sì forte fu l’affettüoso grido.
query.error: **English:** 85 thus they came out of the flock where Dido is, 86 coming to us through the malignant air, 87 so strong was the cry of affection.
query.result: 85 ðus ða ut-eodon of ðære menige ðær Dido wæs, 86 to us cumende ðurh ðone lyftegan lyft, 87 swa ðæt ðæs wilnunge wæs ðæs wopes strengð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 «O animal grazïoso e benigno 89 che visitando vai per l’aere perso 90 noi che tignemmo il mondo di sanguigno,
query.error: **English:** 88 O gracious and gentle beast 89 who, visiting, pass through the darkened air 90 over us who stained the world with blood,
query.result: 88 O gracious and gentle beast 89 who, visiting, pass through the darkened air 90 over us who stained the world with blood,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 se fosse amico il re de l’universo, 92 noi pregheremmo lui de la tua pace, 93 poi c’hai pietà del nostro mal perverso.
query.error: **English:** 91 if the king of the universe were our friend, 92 we would pray to him for your peace, 93 since you have pity for our perverse evil.
query.result: 91 if the king of the universe were our friend, 92 we would pray to him for your peace, 93 since you have pity for our perverse evil.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Di quel che udire e che parlar vi piace, 95 noi udiremo e parleremo a voi, 96 mentre che ’l vento, come fa, ci tace.
query.error: **English:** 94 Of that which you like to hear and speak, 95 we will hear and speak to you, 96 while the wind, as it does, is silent for us.
query.result: 94 Þæs ðe ge hlystan and sprecan lybbað, 95 we gehyrað and secgað eow, 96 ða hwile ðe wind, swa he ded, us þigað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Siede la terra dove nata fui 98 su la marina dove ’l Po discende 99 per aver pace co’ seguaci sui.
query.error: **English:** 97 The land where I was born lies 98 on the shore where the Po descends 99 to find peace with its followers.
query.result: 97 Sitt ða eorðe ðær ic geboren wæs 98 ofer ða sæ ðær ðæs Poes ea 99 to ðære sæ cymeð mid his geferum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Amor, ch’al cor gentil ratto s’apprende, 101 prese costui de la bella persona 102 che mi fu tolta; e ’l modo ancor m’offende.
query.error: **English:** 100 Love, which is quickly learned by the gentle heart, 101 took hold of him for the beautiful person 102 who was taken from me; and the manner still offends me.
query.result: 100 Lufe, ðe ðam æðelan heortan raðe geliðeð, 101 gefangen ðone ðurh ðære fægeran ansyne, 102 ðe me wæs arefnod; and ðæt mod ða gyt mæneð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Amor, ch’a nullo amato amar perdona, 104 mi prese del costui piacer sì forte, 105 che, come vedi, ancor non m’abbandona.
query.error: **English:** 103 Love, which to no loved one allows not loving, 104 seized me with such desire for his beauty, 105 that, as you see, it still does not abandon me.
query.result: 103 Lufe, ðe næfre nænigum lufode lufe forlætan, 104 me nam ðæs monnes wlite swa swiðe, 105 ðæt ðu gesyhst ðæt hit me gyt ne forlæt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Amor condusse noi ad una morte. 107 Caina attende chi a vita ci spense». 108 Queste parole da lor ci fuor porte.
query.error: **English:** 106 Love led us to one death. 107 Cain awaits him who quenched our life." 108 These words were brought to us by them.
query.result: 106 Lufe us lædde to anum deade. 107 Cain abydeð ðone ðe us lif benam." 108 Þas word us wæron togebrohte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Quand’ io intesi quell’ anime offense, 110 china’ il viso, e tanto il tenni basso, 111 fin che ’l poeta mi disse: «Che pense?».
query.error: **English:** 109 When I heard those tormented souls, 110 I lowered my face and kept it down, 111 until the poet said to me: "What are you thinking?".
query.result: 109 Þa ic ða gehyrde ða earman sawla, 110 ic abeah min neb and heold niðer, 111 oððæt se scop me sæde: "Hwæt þenceð ðu?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Quando rispuosi, cominciai: «Oh lasso, 113 quanti dolci pensier, quanto disio 114 menò costoro al doloroso passo!».
query.error: **English:** 112 When I answered, I began: "Oh, alas, 113 how many sweet thoughts, how much desire 114 led these people to the sorrowful pass!"
query.result: 112 Þa ic andwyrde, ic ongan ða cweðan: "Eala, wá lá, 113 hu manega wynlicu ðancas, hu micel gewilnung 114 lædde ðás on ðone sárlican síð!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Poi mi rivolsi a loro e parla’ io, 116 e cominciai: «Francesca, i tuoi martìri 117 a lagrimar mi fanno tristo e pio.
query.error: **English:** 115 Then I turned to them and I spoke, 116 and I began: "Francesca, your torments 117 make me weep with sadness and pity.
query.result: 115 Þa ic me wende to ðam and spræc ic, 116 and ic ongan: "Francesca, ðine martras 117 to weope makiað me sari and sarige."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Ma dimmi: al tempo d’i dolci sospiri, 119 a che e come concedette amore 120 che conosceste i dubbiosi disiri?».
query.error: **English:** 118 But tell me: in the time of sweet sighs, 119 how and in what way did love grant 120 that you knew the uncertain desires?
query.result: 118 Ac sege me: on ðam tide ðara swetra gesihða, 119 hu and on hwylcum wisan lufode getiðde 120 ðæt ðu ða gedwolnan wilnunga cuðe?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 E quella a me: «Nessun maggior dolore 122 che ricordarsi del tempo felice 123 nella miseria; e ciò sa ’l tuo dottore.
query.error: **English:** 121 And she to me: "There is no greater sorrow 122 than to recall a happy time 123 in misery; and this your teacher knows well.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Ma s’a conoscer la prima radice 125 del nostro amor tu hai cotanto affetto, 126 dirò come colui che piange e dice.
query.error: **English:** 124 But if you have such a desire 125 to know the first root 126 of our love, I will tell you as one who weeps and speaks.
query.result: 124 Ac gif ðu ðone frumsceaft witan wilt 125 ure lufe, ðu hafast ðæs micelne willan, 126 ic ðe secge swa ðe se ðe wepeð and cwæð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Noi leggiavamo un giorno per diletto 128 di Lancialotto come amor lo strinse; 129 soli eravamo e sanza alcun sospetto.
query.error: **English:** 127 One day, for our pleasure, we were reading 128 about Lancelot, how love constrained him; 129 we were alone, and without any suspicion.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Per più fïate li occhi ci sospinse 131 quella lettura, e scolorocci il viso; 132 ma solo un punto fu quel che ci vinse.
query.error: **English:** 130 Many times that reading urged our eyes 131 and drained the color from our faces; 132 but it was only one point that overcame us.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Quando leggemmo il disïato riso 134 esser basciato da cotanto amante, 135 questi, che mai da me non fia diviso,
query.error: **English:** 133 When we read how the desired smile 134 was kissed by such a lover, 135 this man, who will never be parted from me,
query.result: 133 Þa we ræddon hu ðæt gewilnode hleahtor 134 wæs gecyst fram ðam leofan men, 135 ðes, ðe næfre fram me ne bið todæled,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 la bocca mi basciò tutto tremante. 137 Galeotto fu ’l libro e chi lo scrisse: 138 quel giorno più non vi leggemmo avante».
query.error: **English:** 136 kissed my mouth, trembling all over. 137 Galeotto was the book and he who wrote it: 138 that day we read no further.
query.result: 136 ða he ða ongan min muð clyppan beofiende. 137 Galewoto wæs ðæt bōc and se ðe hit wrāt: 138 ðone dæg ne ræddon wē furðor ðær.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Mentre che l’uno spirto questo disse, 140 l’altro piangëa; sì che di pietade 141 io venni men così com’ io morisse.
query.error: **English:** 139 While the one spirit said this, 140 the other wept; so that with pity 141 I fainted, as if I were dying.
query.result: 139 Þā ðā ðæt ān gāst ðis sæde, 140 ðæt ōðer weōp; swā ðæt of mildheortnesse 141 ic cwōm of mōde swā swā ic wolde steorfan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 E caddi come corpo morto cade.
query.error: **English:** 142 And he fell as a dead body falls.
query.result: 142 And he feoll ðær fæge swylce feallen ða deade.
